alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Custer; Dewey; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Washita, northwestern Caddo, eastern Custer, western Blaine and southeastern Dewey Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 745 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Oakwood to near Weatherford to near Cloud Chief. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, half inch hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Watonga, Thomas, Hydro, Canton, Corn, Eakly, Longdale, Colony, Greenfield, Oakwood, Canton Lake, Alfalfa, Cloud Chief, Eagle City, Fay, Fort Cobb Reservoir, Hucmac, Cowden, and Southard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
